intro: Johnstonella sheylae, commonly known as the Sikkim bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, preferring cool and moist environments. Johnstonella sheylae has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms during the summer months. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens with suitable climatic conditions.
